topic: Teaching and Learning Methods at UTM
question: What are the updates regarding the Teaching and Learning (TnL) methods for School of Electrical Engineering (SKE) students at UTM?
answer: The first notice issued by SKE on 14 March 2022 stated that face-to-face laboratory implementations will begin on Week 5 (17 April 2022). TnL will be online until the end of Semester 2 2021/2022, with final examinations conducted physically from 10 to 28 July 2022. Academic Circular No. 2/2022 dated 31 March 2022 states all TnL activities will be carried out physically and face-to-face or in a blended manner. A second notice dated 6 April 2022 states the change of TnL method to face-to-face/physical starting Week 7 (8 May 2022). Students constrained from entering campus (e.g., health, financial, family) after the mid-semester break may inform their lecturers and academic advisors to determine the learning method, but must ensure they are on campus before the final exam.

topic: Online Guest Lecture on Communication
question: What are the details of the 2nd Online Guest Lecture by Innovate Malaysia?
answer: The 2nd Online Guest Lecture by Innovate Malaysia is on the topic 'Communication with Structure'. It will be held on 14 April 2022 from 3pm to 4pm via MS Teams. The speaker is Karena Kamaruzaman from Intel. Registration is open for all university students at https://forms.gle/VfsgcB5rf8gULYFy9.

topic: Student Concerns on Face-to-Face Learning
question: What are the concerns of students regarding the face-to-face learning decision at UTM?
answer: Students are concerned about the decision to return to face-to-face learning, especially those who face constraints such as health, financial, or family issues. They feel the decision was made without proper consultation and are seeking ways to address their concerns through formal channels like the Student Affairs and Academic Committee.

topic: Teaching and Learning Feedback
question:
Teaching and Learning Feedback Form (SKE)
README FIRST
-----------------------
The School of Electrical Engineering will conduct its Teaching and Learning in physical mode immediately after mid semester break. This decision has been made public on 6th of April 2022 and you may refer it here: 

https://engineering.utm.my/electrical/blog/2022/04/06/teaching-and-learning-tl-modes-for-semester-2021-2022-2/

This form is to gather feedback from students who are having difficulties/delays in attending the physical classes. You may return your feedback explaining your issue(s) using this form. Please submit this form only once. The School will carefully consider your response before deciding on the TnL mode most suitable for you.

Final examination will be done physically for all students.

The last date to return this feedback is 23 April 2022 2359 hrs (MYT).

Link: https://forms.gle/59cekahDbsw9Pwjf6
answer:
